item.title: Facebook-owned WhatsApp reaches 900 million monthly active users
item.description: WhatsApp has grown tremendously from the time Facebook acquired it in 2014 for $19 billion. The messaging app's founder, Jan Koum, has just announced on Facebook that the service has reached 900 million monthly active users (MAU). That means it has...
item.dc:creator: Mariella Moon

item.title: Google expands health conditions feature to include 900 illnesses
item.description: Google is making it easier to look up illness, so you don't have to wait for websites to load in order to get a quick overview of what you might (or might not) be dealing with. Mountain View has doubled the number of diseases in its health conditio...
item.dc:creator: Mariella Moon

item.title: Chrome's next update makes it less resource hungry
item.description: A big part of what's won Chrome a lot of converts is how much faster it is over the competition. That speed comes at a price, though: The web browser is notoriously a resource hog (especially if you have a dozen or so tabs open at once) and it dram...
item.dc:creator: Timothy J. Seppala

item.title: Google's driverless cars skirt deer and pedestrians in Texas
item.description: By the looks of things, Google's self-driving cars have been learning a lot in Austin, Texas. In its first report since it began testing autonomous vehicles in the city, the company details the challenges its cars have had to face while driving on...
item.dc:creator: Mariella Moon

item.title: Mozilla is ready to test Firefox on iOS, but only in New Zealand
item.description: iPhone and iPads owners looking for a browser alternative are one step closer to seeing Mozilla's option on their devices, but right now a "preview" of the app is only available in New Zealand. In a blog post it says this limitation is so it can ga...
item.dc:creator: Richard Lawler

item.title: DOJ's new Stingray rules: feds need a warrant to track phones
item.description: Over the last few years, we've learned that US law enforcement agencies not only regularly use "Stingray" devices to locate suspects by their cellphones, but go to great lengths to hide this activity. After extensive reporting on the subject, the D...
item.dc:creator: Richard Lawler

item.title: IFA Day 1: 4K Smartphones and water-cooled laptops
item.description: IFA started with a bang as Sony whipped out the Xperia Z5 Premium, a smartphone that comes with the "world's first" 5.5-inch 4K display. That was swiftly followed by the launch of Huawei's Mate S, a phone that's designed to kill the iPhone 6 Plus...
item.dc:creator: Daniel Cooper

item.title: Playdate: Going back to school with 'No Pineapple Left Behind'
item.description: Back to school. Those three words can strike fear in even the hardiest of kids. We're celebrating the beginning of the semester a little differently, because, well, that's what we do on Playdate. Rather than spend the afternoon quoting Billy Madiso...
item.dc:creator: Timothy J. Seppala

item.title: Autonomous robosub hunts starfish with poison-tipped needles
item.description: Crown-of-thorns starfish (COTS) are voracious coral consumers with a propensity for population explosions, which makes them very real threats to the world's coral reefs. And while they're typically held in check by fish higher in the food chain, ov...
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tarantola

item.title: Apple will reportedly outfit the 21.5-inch iMac with a 4K display
item.description: Almost a year ago, Apple put a Retina display inside its 27-inch desktop. A report from 9to5Mac says we could see a high-res panel on the smaller 21.5-inch model soon as well. The word comes from Mark Gurman, who has a solid track record for news l...
item.dc:creator: Billy Steele

item.title: Samsung teases Galaxy View tablet at the end of IFA event
item.description: Samsung is making a habit of teasing its next announcement at the end of launch events. After today's Gear S2 official reveal, the company teased a new tablet: the Galaxy View. Of course, details are quite scarce right now, but we do know that the...
item.dc:creator: Billy Steele

item.title: Waze sued for allegedly stealing map data
item.description: Google and its mapping service Waze are being dragged to court over allegations that Waze stole data from a rival's map database. The lawsuit filed in San Francisco federal court on Tuesday by PhantomAlert alleges that the navigation app used propr...
item.dc:creator: Roberto Baldwin

item.title: Netflix teases second season of 'Narcos' a week after its debut
item.description: Netflix's newest original series, Narcos, just hit the streaming service last week, and the early reviews have been positive. The company seems to think pretty highly of the show, too. In fact, it's already teasing us with word of a second season....
item.dc:creator: Billy Steele

item.title: The Wirecutter's best deals: the Pebble Steel, Fitbit Charge HR and more
item.description: This post was created in partnership with The Wirecutter, a list of the best technology to buy. Read their continuously updated list of deals at TheWirecutter.com. You may have already seen Engadget posting reviews from our friends at The Wirecutt...
item.dc:creator: The Wirecutter

item.title: Your phone knows if you're bored by how much you use it
item.description: Researchers at Barcelona's Telefonica Research lab have developed a smartphone-based algorithm that determines a user's level of boredom based on how much they're using the device. The algorithm also takes a number of factors such as time of day an...
item.dc:creator: Andrew Tarantola

item.title: Tech giants settle anti-poaching lawsuit for $415 million
item.description: Silicon Valley's anti-poaching conspiracy has reached its conclusion. U.S. District Judge Lucy Koh has approved the $415 million settlement, suggested by Apple, Google, Intel and Adobe earlier this year. The four tech giants have long been accused...
item.dc:creator: Mona Lalwani

item.title: Mercedes' newest mini car is one you'd actually want to drive
item.description: If you live in a metropolitan area like San Francisco, New York or Chicago, you understand the appeal of a tiny car. It's easier to swoop through traffic and it can be parked nearly anywhere. Smart says the Fortwo is the tiniest of the tiny cars av...
item.dc:creator: Roberto Baldwin

item.title: T-Mobile lets you dial up a video chat just like a regular call
item.description: T-Mobile has launched a video calling feature that you can access straight from your smartphone's stock phone dialer. With T-Mobile Video Calling, "there's no need to search out, download, configure and register additional apps," said CTO Neville R...
item.dc:creator: Steve Dent

item.title: Bang and Olufsen's BeoPlay A6 is a $1,000 wireless speaker
item.description: Luxury audiovisual brand Bang & Olufsen (B&O) has just announced a pricey wireless speaker, the $999 BeoPlay A6. The style evokes the back of a chair, gently curving and covered in designer fabric from Danish studio Kvadrat. Apparently, thi...
item.dc:creator: Aaron Souppouris

item.title: Samsung finally has an elegant smartwatch in the Gear S2
item.description: Few companies have churned out as many different smartwatches as Samsung, so it's little surprise the company is showing off a new one — the Gear S2 — at IFA. What is a surprise, though, is how much more elegant, more polished the S2 fe...
item.dc:creator: Chris Velazco

item.title: LG's new G Pad II really isn't anything new
item.description: LG's never been scared of trying new things when it comes to smartphones, even pioneering the strange-yet-convenient back button placement other manufacturers have copied since. By comparison, the company has played it safe with its G Pad tablet rang...
item.dc:creator: Jamie Rigg

item.title: Skype 6.0 brings revamped design to both iOS and Android
item.description: Skype users have ridden a rollercoaster of different designs over the years, and the latest version promises yet more change. Version 6.0 has been completely redesigned for both iOS and Android apps, which are now in lockstep with each other. For...
item.dc:creator: Steve Dent

item.title: Withings unveils a sleep-savvy clock and more Android support
item.description: Like the idea of Withings' Aura improving your sleep cycles, but don't need a $300 gadget tracking every last nuance of your slumber? You're in luck. Withings is rolling out a lower-cost device, the $190 Connected Alarm Clock, that keeps the sleep-...
item.dc:creator: Jon Fingas

item.title: Watch the trailer for the BBC's GTA drama 'The Gamechangers'
item.description: Today we got our first glimpse of the BBC's upcoming Grand Theft Auto docudrama, which examines the game's development and public scrutiny in 2002. The Gamechangers, starring Daniel Radcliffe as Rockstar president Sam Houser, covers the franchise's...
item.dc:creator: Nick Summers

item.title: IFTTT brings one-touch app control to Android Wear devices
item.description: The recipe-based automation software IFTTT delivered its one-button control app to phones back in February, and now it's putting it on your wrist. Android Wear gadgets can now employ the DO Button to complete any number of tasks that you assign to...
item.dc:creator: Billy Steele
